newsitem.title: MEXICO: RESEARCH ALERT-Hogar started as buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Hogar started as buy.

text.p: Mexican brokerage Serfin said Tuesday it started coverage of Consorcio Hogar, a Mexican house builder, with a buy rating.
-- The firm estimated the company's 1997 earnings per share at 1.14 pesos.

"Its excellent financial structure after its recent share issue and its policy of reinvesting profits will allow it to increase sales without running up an excessive leverage level," Serfin analyst Gerardo Saaenz wrote in a report.

-- Serfin said they fixed a target price of 15.75 pesos for Guadalajara-based Hogar for the next six months, representing an expected increase of about 38 percent over current prices, and hence the buy recommendation.
-- "Their strategy is to build low-cost housing...which is a potential market not being explored by competitors," Serfin said.
